channel.title: Nividia Server Ip (impossible to find? 0.0)
channel.description:
I have searched everywhere in nividia's SERVER files for the ip address to change it (including server.java and client.java). as far as i can tell it's a pi. and i dont know crap about pi. If someone can please point me in the right direction on where to find it (and no, it isnt what the is say's it is on the server downloads page, which it said it was "server = "Ip over here"") Pm me or add my msn: jessew@myself.com remember, i am looking for the SERVER ip. not the client ip.
I put all caps on the word server because mod's like to delete this thinking it isn't a good question.

item.title: Nividia Server Ip (impossible to find? 0.0)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:8, topic:396453”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=493622.msg3609016#msg3609016 date=1306372539]

use the search thing that searches folders. Just put what you wanna search. If you are windows xp then its search companion, if you are vista or 7 then its on the top right corner.

Hope this helps!,
Arham

already tried…
[/quote]
Try using the Z-file searcher, it may be in there. If not, ask the creator where he put it.[/quote]
The creator said the ip is in client.java and is located by searching "server = “ip over here” "
I have looked for that, and i also found this ip of his nividia.zapto.org and i searched for tht also. and the other 2 defaults i have searched for is 0.0.0.0 and 127.0.0.1

Read full topic
